sen.j: 幸清流（こうせい-りゅう）または幸清次郎流（こう-せいじろう・りゅう）は能楽小鼓方の一流派。
sen.e: Kosei-ryu school, or Ko Seijiro-ryu school, is one of schools of Nohgaku kotsuzumi-kata (small hand drum player).
The Kosei school, or Ko Seijiro school, is one of the schools of kotsuzumi-kata (small hand drum players) in Nohgaku (the art of Noh).
sen.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一しました。
sen.e: The Kosei school, or Ko Seijiro school, is one of the schools of kotsuzumi-kata (small hand drum players) in Nohgaku (the art of Noh).
Explanation
Description
sen.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一しました。
sen.e: Description

sen.j: 小鼓方幸流の分家である。
sen.e: It is a branch school of kotsuzumi-kata of Ko school.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: It is a branch school of kotsuzumi-kata of Ko school.
It is a branch school of kotsuzumi-kata of Ko school.

sen.j: 二世五郎次郎正能の後、嫡孫清次郎了能が幼少であったため、二男小左衛門一宗が三世を襲い、後に了能が別家して流儀を興した。
sen.e: After the 2nd soke (head of family) of Ko school Gorojiro Masayoshi died, his second son Kozaemon Kazumune succeeded the 3rd soke because Masayoshi's legitimate grandson Seijiro Ryono was too young, and Ryono later became independent and founded the school.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理 清次郎了能→読み不明
sen.e: After the second head of the Ko school Gorojiro Masayoshi died, his second son Kozaemon Kazumune (小左衛門一宗) succeeded to the third head of the family because Masayoshi's legitimate grandson Seijiro Satoyoshi (清次郎了能) was too young; later Satoyoshi became independent and founded the school.
sen.cmt: 読みが不明な人名に漢字を追記しました。
sen.e: After the second head of the Ko school Gorojiro Masayoshi died, his second son Kozaemon Kazumune (小左衛門一宗) succeeded to the third head of the family because Masayoshi's legitimate grandson Seijiro Satoyoshi (清次郎了能) was too young; later Satoyoshi became independent and founded the school.

sen.j: このため作法や譜は幸流にきわめて近いが、装飾的な替えの手組みを多く持つところに特色がある。
sen.e: Therefore, its manner and music are very similar to those of Ko school, but its characteristic is using varieties of decorative tegumi (a rhythm pattern).
Therefore, its manner and music score are very similar to those of Ko school, but its characteristic is using varieties of decorative tegumi (a rhythm pattern).
Therefore, its manner and music score are very similar to those of Ko school, but its characteristic is using varieties of decorative tegumi (a rhythm pattern).

sen.j: 東京・名古屋が主要な地盤で、能楽協会には10名の役者が登録されている（2008年6月30日現在）。
sen.e: Its main bases of activity are Tokyo and Nagoya, and ten players are being registered at The Nohgaku Players' Association (as of June 30, 2008).
Its main bases of activity are Tokyo and Nagoya, and ten players are registered with the Nohgaku Performers' Association (as of June 30, 2008).
sen.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一しました。
sen.e: Its main bases of activity are Tokyo and Nagoya, and ten players are registered with the Nohgaku Performers' Association (as of June 30, 2008).

sen.j: 現宗家は十五世幸清次郎能満。
sen.e: Its current soke is the 15th Ko Seijiro Yoshimitsu.
The present head of the school is the 15th, Seijiro Yoshimitsu KO.
sen.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一しました。
sen.e: The present head of the school is the 15th, Seijiro Yoshimitsu KO.
